meanings.definition: To participate in a religious ceremony with other priests.
meanings.sent1: During the service, the priests concelebrated together.
meanings.sent2: The clergy members concelebrated the Mass on Sunday.
meanings.sent3: The priests decided to concelebrate wearing colorful hats for a change.
meanings.sent4: Their unity in faith was beautifully symbolized as they concelebrated under the same roof.
meanings.sent5: The act of concelebrating made the religious ceremony more meaningful and powerful.

meanings.definition: To jointly celebrate a religious service with other clergy members.
meanings.sent1: The bishops and priests concelebrated the special service.
meanings.sent2: They always concelebrate the important holidays together.
meanings.sent3: The group of clergy decided to concelebrate by singing hymns in harmony.
meanings.sent4: Their voices concelebrated in a beautiful melody that echoed through the church.
meanings.sent5: The act of concelebrating brought a sense of togetherness and shared purpose among the clergy.
